item.title: High prices temper festive cheer at Cox’s Bazar
item.description: Cox’s Bazar, the country’s leading tourist destination, has drawn tourists in droves during the combined Christmas and weekend holidays, with hotel rooms fully booked and the shoreline crowded even on foggy mornings. From Sugandha Point to Kolatali, the beach has been lined with touris

item.title: UIU holds 8th convocation on its campus
item.description: The 8th Convocation of United International University (UIU) was held on Saturday at UIU Campus, United City, Madani Avenue, in the city. Prof. Dr. Abu Borhan Mohammad Badruzzaman, Vice Chancellor of Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology (BUET) presided over the ceremony on behalf of

item.title: Bangladesh cricket mourns beloved pace coach Zaki
item.description: Mahbub Ali Zaki arrived at the ground in the team bus in the afternoon. Even during the warm-up, he remained involved, moving with purpose and familiarity. By evening, that same man returned from the hospital sealed in a coffin. The ground where he had collapsed before his team’s match becam

item.title: Chief Justice Syed Refaat Ahmed retires
item.description: The country's 25th Chief Justice Dr Syed Refaat Ahmed retired on Saturday upon attaining the age of 67, as mandated by the Constitution. Meanwhile, Justice Zubayer Rahman Chowdhury of the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court has already been appointed as the country's 26th Chief Justice. He wil

item.title: Mogolhat: A cross-border rail connection erased by the Dharla
item.description: Flanked by a blend of dense greenery and rustic beauty, our autorickshaw speeds towards Mogolhat from the Mission intersection, the heart of the Lalmonirhat district. Cows and goats graze in fields despite an intermittent drizzle on a September morning. Bamboo, betel nut, and banana are among the t

item.title: Russia downs 111 Ukrainian drones in three hours, defence ministry says
item.description: Russia's Defence Ministry said its air defence systems had intercepted and destroyed 111 Ukrainian drones in three hours over six Russian regions, including eight over Moscow. The capital's mayor Sergei Sobyanin said another batch of 11 drones were also later shot down en route to the city. Russi

item.title: Bogura-7 sees two BNP nominations as Milton joins party Khaleda’s ticket
item.description: BNP Chairperson Begum Khaleda Zia had already collected her nomination papers for Bogura-7 (Gabtoli-Shajahanpur) ahead of the February elections. On Saturday, Morshed Milton, president of Gabtali Upazila BNP, filed his nomination from the same constituency, marking the second nomination in the sea

item.title: Pakistan's first female central bank head Shamshad Akhtar dies
item.description: Shamshad Akhtar, the first and only woman to lead Pakistan's central bank and a two-time caretaker finance minister, died at 71, the finance ministry said on Saturday. Akhtar was serving as chairperson of the Pakistan Stock Exchange at the time of her death, giving her a rare role spanning Pakista

item.title: 30 NCP leaders urge Nahid Islam not to form alliance with Jamaat
item.description: Thirty leaders of the National Citizens Party (NCP) have written to party convener Nahid Islam, urging him not to form any political alliance with Jamaat-e-Islami, citing the party’s controversial historical role and recent divisive activities. The memorandum, delivered on Saturday, expresse

item.title: Protests continue over justice for Hadi
item.description: Protests demanding justice for Shaheed Sharif Osman bin Hadi, spokesperson of Inqilab Moncho, continued for the second consecutive day at Shahbagh in the capital on Saturday. Protesters, including women and children, joined the demonstration and chanted various slogans. As of 8:30 pm, demonstrato

item.title: BSF halts fence construction at Joypurhat border after BGB intervention
item.description: Indian Border Security Force (BSF) attempted to construct a barbed wire fence at the Ghonapara border in Panchbibi upazila of Joypurhat on Saturday morning, violating international border regulations, but were forced to stop after intervention by Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB). Early Saturday morni

item.title: Tarique visits Evercare again to see ailing mother
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman visited Evercare Hospital in the capital on Saturday night to see his ailing mother and former Prime Minister Begum Khaleda Zia.
